item.title: Pokemon GO Reveals December Community Day Plans
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Pokemon GO December Community Day on December 21-22 features many different Pokemon.
  • Event bonuses include double XP, candy, and extended Lure Modules, with Timed Research and Field Research available.
  • There will be featured attacks available when evolving Pokemon, 2 km egg spawns, and perks like reduced Stardust trade cost during the event.

Pokemon GO has revealed its plans for December's Community Day, the last edition of the event in 2024. Community Day is a recurring event on the Pokemon GO calendar, known for featuring a pocket monster and offering other perks to players. With the end of the year, the augmented reality game takes a trip down memory lane with a special Community Day in December.

Niantic opened 2024 with Rowlet, Chansey, and Litten as the Community Day Pokemon for January, February, and March. For Grass-type fans, April and May had Bellsprout and Bounsweet, with Goomy, Tynamo, and Popplio in the June, July, and August editions of the event. September's Community Day was special, as it featured Ponyta and its regional variant, followed by Sewaddle and Mankey, which appeared in the October and November events.

Now, Pokemon GO has revealed the plans for December's Community Day, which will run from December 21-22 from 2 pm to 5 pm local time. Each day, a selection of Pokemon will be available, with Rowlet and five other pocket monsters appearing on December 21. Meanwhile, Ponyta, Galarian Ponyta, and four other critters will appear on December 22. In the final 10 minutes of each hour, Niantic will increase the spawns of Porygon, Cyndaquil, Bagon, and Beldum. As with other Pokemon GO events, players can expect bonuses such as double XP and Candy when catching Pokemon, and Lure Modules with extended duration.

Pokemon GO Community Day December 2024 Details

  • When: Saturday, December 21, and Sunday, December 22, 2024, from 2 pm to 5 pm local time.
  • New Timed Research, Community Day Continued Timed Research, Field Research, Stickers, and PokeStop Showcases will be available.

Event Bonuses

  • 2× XP for catching Pokemon.
  • 2× Stardust for catching Pokemon.
  • 1/2 Hatch Distance when Eggs are placed into Incubators during the event period.
  • 2× Candy for catching Pokemon.
  • 2× chance for Trainers level 31 and up to receive Candy XL from catching Pokemon.
  • Lure Modules activated during the event will last for three hours.
  • Incense (excluding Daily Adventure Incense) activated during the event will last for three hours.
  • One additional Special Trade can be made, for a maximum of two per day.*
  • Trades made during the event will require 50% less Stardust.*

* While most bonuses are only active on December 21 and 22 from 2:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. local time, these bonuses will be active from 9:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. local time on those days.

Featured Pokemon

Saturday, December 21, 2024, from 2 pm to 5 pm local time

  • Bellsprout*
  • Chansey*
  • Goomy*
  • Rowlet*
  • Litten*
  • Bounsweet*

Sunday, December 22, 2024, from 2 pm to 5 pm local time

  • Mankey*
  • Ponyta*
  • Galarian Ponyta*
  • Sewaddle*
  • Tynamo*
  • Popplio*

The last 10 minutes of each hour between 2 pm and 5 pm local time will increase the spawns of:

  • Porygon*
  • Cyndaquil*
  • Bagon*
  • Beldum*

* Shiny chance

2 Km Egg Spawns

  • Slowpoke*
  • Galarian Slowpoke*
  • Poliwag*
  • Togepi*
  • Wooper*
  • Paldean Wooper*
  • Timburr*
  • Axew*
  • Chespin*
  • Fennekin*
  • Froakie*
  • Grubbin*
  • Noibat*

* Shiny chance

Featured Attacks

The following featured attacks will be available when evolving these Pokemon during the event.

Poliwrath

  • Evolve Poliwhirl (Poliwag’s Evolution) to get a Poliwrath that knows the Fast Attack Counter.

Politoed

  • Evolve Poliwhirl (Poliwag’s Evolution) with a King’s Rock to get a Politoed that knows the Charged Attack Ice Beam.

Victreebel

  • Evolve Weepinbell (Bellsprout’s Evolution) to get a Victreebel that knows the Fast Attack Magical Leaf.

Rapidash and Galarian Rapidash

  • Evolve Ponyta or Galarian Ponyta to get a Rapidash or Galarian Rapidash that knows the Charged Attack Wild Charge.

Slowbro, Galarian Slowbro, Slowking, and Galarian Slowking

  • Evolve Slowpoke or Galarian Slowpoke to get a Slowbro, Galarian Slowbro, Slowking, or Galarian Slowking that knows the Charged Attack Surf.

Typhlosion

  • Evolve Quilava (Cyndaquil’s Evolution) to get a Typhlosion that knows the Charged Attack Blast Burn.

Blissey

  • Evolve Chansey to get a Blissey that knows the Charged Attack Wild Charge.

Togekiss

  • Evolve Togetic (Togepi’s Evolution) to get a Togekiss that knows the Charged Attack Aura Sphere.

Quagsire

  • Evolve Wooper to get a Quagsire that knows the Charged Attack Aqua Tail.

Salamence

  • Evolve Shelgon (Bagon’s Evolution) to get a Salamence that knows the Charged Attack Outrage.

Metagross

  • Evolve Metang (Beldum’s Evolution) to get a Metagross that knows the Charged Attack Meteor Mash.

Porygon-Z

  • Evolve Porygon2 (Porygon’s Evolution) to get a Porygon-Z that knows the Charged Attack Tri Attack.

Conkeldurr

  • Evolve Gurdurr (Timburr’s Evolution) to get a Conkeldurr that knows the Charged Attack Brutal Swing.

Leavanny

  • Evolve Swadloon (Sewaddle’s Evolution) to get a Leavanny that knows the Fast Attack Shadow Claw.

Eelektross

  • Evolve Eelektrik (Tynamo’s Evolution) to get an Eelektross that knows the Fast Attack Volt Switch.

Haxorus

  • Evolve Fraxure (Axew’s Evolution) to get a Haxorus that knows the Charged Attack Breaking Swipe.

Chesnaught

  • Evolve Quilladin (Chespin’s Evolution) to get a Chesnaught that knows the Charged Attack Frenzy Plant.

Delphox

  • Evolve Braixen (Fennekin’s Evolution) to get a Delphox that knows the Charged Attack Blast Burn.

Greninja

  • Evolve Frogadier (Froakie’s Evolution) to get a Greninja that knows the Charged Attack Hydro Cannon.

Goodra

  • Evolve Sliggoo (Goomy’s Evolution) to get a Goodra that knows the Charged Attack Thunder Punch.

Noivern

  • Evolve Noibat to get a Noivern that knows the Charged Attack Boomburst.

Decidueye

  • Evolve Dartrix (Rowlet’s Evolution) to get a Decidueye that knows the Charged Attack Frenzy Plant.

Incineroar

  • Evolve Torracat (Litten’s Evolution) to get an Incineroar that knows the Charged Attack Blast Burn.

Primarina

  • Evolve Brionne (Popplio’s Evolution) to get a Primarina that knows the Charged Attack Hydro Cannon.

Vikavolt

  • Evolve Charjabug (Grubbin’s Evolution) to get a Vikavolt that knows the Fast Attack Volt Switch. Grubbin that evolve into Charjabug during this period will also know Volt Switch.

Tsareena

  • Evolve Steenee (Bounsweet’s Evolution) to get a Tsareena that knows the Charged Attack High Jump Kick.

Annihilape

  • Evolve Primeape (Mankey’s Evolution) to get an Annihilape that knows the Charged Attack Rage Fist. Mankey that evolve into Primeape during this period will also know Rage Fist.

Clodsire

  • Evolve Paldean Wooper to get a Clodsire that knows the Charged Attack Mega Horn.

By hatching 2 km eggs in Pokemon GO during the event, players will have the chance to obtain monsters from a reward pool that includes Slowpoke, Togepi, and Wooper. Players who level up the Pokemon featured on Community Day will get an evolution with a specific Fast or Charged Attack. Timed Research and Continued Timed Research will be available, the latter rewarding Pokemon encounters with a special background. The event will also have new Field Research, Showcases, and 2024 Community Days stickers that players can get by spinning PokeStops, opening Gifts, or buying in the in-game store.

With the unveiling of Pokemon GO December Community Day plans, players wait for details on Holiday Part 2, New Year's 2025, and Charged Embers Hatch Day events. Meanwhile, other events are already confirmed and will begin or end in the next few days, such as the debut of Gigantamax Lapras on December 8. The Aspiring Dragons Research Day ends on December 12, while Genesect Chill Drive returns to Pokemon GO in the Young and Wise event on December 10.

item.title: Sony Signed PS2 GTA Exclusivity Deal Because of Xbox
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Sony made GTA a PS2 exclusive due to concerns about the Xbox.
  • GTA 3's success on PS2 was unexpected due to gameplay changes.
  • The exclusivity deal helped boost PS2 sales and GTA popularity.

A former Sony head has revealed that Grand Theft Auto was a PlayStation 2 exclusive because of the Xbox. The executive spoke during a recent interview, where he acknowledged that Sony had been concerned about the coming Microsoft console, and that led to three GTA games being PS2-exclusive.

Grand Theft Auto 3 was a massive success, but its overwhelming popularity came as a bit of a surprise to some members of the game development community. Though it was already an established series, GTA 3 dramatically shook up gameplay, switching from a top-down view to third-person, and away from a level-based score system. GTA 3 became one of the best-selling games on the PlayStation 2, and that's due in part to this exclusivity deal.

In a recent interview with GamesIndustry.biz, former PlayStation Europe president Chris Deering spoke about the PlayStation 2 and Sony's concerns over the then up-and-coming Xbox console. In advance of the Xbox's launch, Deering said the company approached a few of its "favorite" third-party publishers and developers with an offer for a two-year exclusivity period. Take-Two was one of these publishers, and it agreed to the deal, locking down its next three games with the PlayStation family of consoles. As a result, GTA 3 , Vice City , and San Andreas all launched on the PlayStation 2 first, remaining solely accessible on PlayStation and PC for the exclusivity period.

GTA Deal Worked Out Great for PlayStation and Take-Two

As Deering states, the deal was a good one for Take-Two, as the publisher "got a discount on the royalty they paid." GTA likely helped to sell PlayStation 2 consoles, while those who had already bought PS2 consoles were enticed to try GTA as it began to explode in popularity. In the end, the aforementioned GTA trilogy became three of the top five of the PS2's best sellers over the course of its lifespan, with GTA 3 coming in fifth, GTA: Vice City in third, and GTA: San Andreas in first.

While the games would eventually be released for the Xbox family of consoles, Xbox gamers had to wait to get their hands on them. Interestingly, GTA 6 is currently slated to arrive for the PlayStation 5 and the Xbox Series X/S at the same time, but no announcement has been made for a GTA 6 PC release. It will almost surely reach that platform eventually, but for the moment, gamers have to wait and see when that will happen. While the PlayStation and Xbox family of systems continue to compete with each other, there's practically no doubt that both consoles will see a massive influx of sales once the game finally launches on their platforms.

item.title: Fortnite: How to Get Spider-Punk, Spider-Noir & Peter B. Parker
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Get Spider-Punk in Fortnite
  • How to Get Spider-Man Noir in Fortnite
  • How to Get Peter B. Parker in Fortnite
  • How to Get the Spider-Gang Bundle

Spider-Man can never seem to catch a break. This absolute icon from the Marvel Universe is constantly involved in shenanigans and heroics that flex his great power and great responsibility, to the point where his web is constantly stretched across an entire Multiverse. Now, it seems as if Fortnite is the latest universe to call upon Spidey's help... again.

Spider-Man rejoins Fortnite , and players already have an abundance of Wall-Crawlers to choose from. Whether it's Miles Morales, Peter Parker, Gwen Stacey, or even MCU variants. However, the latest Spider-Man x Fortnite collab brings Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse skins into the game, and here's how players can get their hands on the ever-popular Spider-Punk, Spider-Man Noir, and Peter B. Parker.

How to Get Spider-Punk in Fortnite

1,800 V-Bucks

  • Spider-Punk Bundle Link

Spider-Punk was highly regarded in Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse , and it seems that years after his strong impression with fans, he has come to the Fortnite scene. Spider-Punk doesn't usually play by the rules, but this arachnid anarchist is going to have a blast with the varying methods to win in Battle Royale. Spider-Punk is easily one of the best Fortnite skins ever made due to how his art style translates so perfectly into the game, complete with his alternating color outlines that makes him so iconic. The reason Spider-Punk costs 1,800 V-Bucks isn't just for the great skin, but he also comes with a masked LEGO variant, Hobie's Amp Back Bling, and Hobie's Wicked Electric Guitar to use in Fortnite Festival .

Spider-Punk is available to purchase from the Item Shop until December 13, 2024, at 7 PM ET.

How to Get Spider-Man Noir in Fortnite

1,500 V-Bucks

  • Spider-Man Noir Bundle Link

Spider-Noir left quite an impression on fans with his appearance in Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse . Not only is this iconic hero played by the one and only Nicolas Cage, but his dazzling and hardened art style from the pulp noir of the 1930s makes for a great skin, and a likely candidate for the try-hards out there who like to use dark skins for shadowy areas. Spider-Man Noir can be purchased for 1,500 V-Bucks, and it comes with a LEGO variant and the Spider-Man Noir's Satchel Back Bling.

Spider-Man Noir is available to purchase from the Item Shop until December 13, 2024, at 7 PM ET.

How to Get Peter B. Parker in Fortnite

1,500 V-Bucks

Peter B. Parker Bundle Link

Peter B. Parker joins the Spider-Gang in Fortnite , handing in most of his iconic spandex to relish in his new responsibility as a dad. This Spider-Man variant comes with a fuzzy pink bathrobe and a pair of slippers to make for a comfortable outfit that might not be the most suitable for the heroics that await in Battle Royale. While most fans of the Spider-Verse movies might be a tad disappointed that the art style isn't used here to bring a full-suited and booted Spider-Man to the game, it's still nice to see Peter B. join the family. Those who purchase Peter B. Parker will also receive Mayday's Diaper Bag as a Back Bling, and a LEGO variant of Peter B. Parker for LEGO Fortnite modes.

Peter B. Parker is available to purchase from the Item Shop until December 13, 2024, at 7 PM ET.

How to Get the Spider-Gang Bundle

3,800 V-Bucks

Spider-Gang Bundle Link

Players who just can't decide on a favorite Spider-Verse character to take into Battle Royale can grab the Spider-Gang Bundle. This is a great deal for those who love the three characters of Spider-Punk, Peter B. Parker and Spider-Man Noir, as it packages all three of them, along with their Bundle items and other cosmetics, for just 3,800 V-Bucks instead of the separate price of 6,400 V-Bucks. Here's a look at all the items in the Spider-Gang Bundle:

Name

Type

Individual Cost

Peter B. Parker

Outfit

1,500 V-Bucks

Peter B. Parker

LEGO Style

Comes with Peter B. Parker

The Spider-Gang Bundle is available to purchase from the Item Shop until December 13, 2024, at 7 PM ET.

item.title: Accidental Win - From Thin Air!
item.description: A player scores a triple elimination with a single sniper shot and more.

item.title: New York Times Connections Hints and Answers for #545 December 7, 2024
item.description:
Connections is a daily puzzle with a big challenge for anyone trying to win: there is a difficult group of words and four categories that are very hard to guess at. And the only clues you have are the words you have to sort themselves.

If you are familiar with how to play Connections , you probably already know how difficult these things can be. In the sections below are all sorts of things to help you, from spoilers to hints and a whole lot more.

Words in the NYT Connections Puzzle #545 for December 7, 2024

The Connections puzzle for today contains the words: Sun, Fly, Horn, Wings, Associate, Legs, Fellow, Bow, Storm, Chum, Relate, Liberty, Bait, Equate, Lure, and Affiliate.

Hints for the NYT Connections Puzzle

Every section below contains a different kind of hint or spoiler for today's New York Times Connections . Open them up with the Read More buttons below them to see what's hiding inside.

Some General Hints for the Whole Connections Puzzle

Yellow NYT Connections Category Hints

Yellow Connections Category Answer

Yellow Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Green NYT Connections Category Hints

Green Connections Category Answer

Green Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Blue NYT Connections Category Hints

Blue Connections Category Answer

Blue Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Purple NYT Connections Category Hints

Purple Connections Category Answer

Purple Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Answers for Today's NYT Connections #545 for December 7, 2024

Seeking the full spoiler for this challenging puzzle game? The complete answer to this puzzle is in the section below, complete with all the categories and where each of the sixteen words need to end up.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Connections website available on almost any device with a browser.
